greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest digit of all divisors of n.
comment: Also smallest digit of concatenation of all divisors  of n (A037278, A176558).

Also characteristic function of numbers n such that smallest digit among all divisors of n is 1 (A209931), in other words, numbers whose divisor set does not contain any number with a nonleading zero.
Sequence is not the same as A168184, first deviation is at a(101): A168184(101) = 1, a(101) = 0.
Sequence is not the same as A168046, first deviation is at a(214): A168046(214) = 1, a(214) = 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
example: a(214) = 0 because smallest digit of all divisors of 214 (1, 2, 107, 214) is 0.
xref: Cf. A168046, A209928 (largest digit of all divisors of n), A054054 (smallest digit of n).
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Mar 20 2012
